  • Indiana state law states any person who has reason to believe that a child is a victim of child abuse or neglect has an affirmative duty to make an oral report to:
    • Child Protective Services (CPS) or
    • local law enforcement.
  • In addition, state law and university policy also require that administrators, faculty, staff, students, volunteers, and other university personnel report any suspected or known child abuse or neglect to the University Director of Public Safety or his/her designee.
  • The University Director of Public Safety has the obligation to report any suspected abuse to CPS which will conduct an investigation.
  • Failure to report may result in criminal charges.

• Report any suspected child abuse, inappropriate conduct, or neglect to the following:
    • Child Protective Services (CPS) at 1-800-800-5556 and/or to
    • Local law enforcement officials by dialing 911, and to
    • The University Director of Public Safety at (812) 464-1845
  • All employees and students who interact with children as part of their work-related duties or academic program, and visitors to the university who have contact with children must be familiar with and abide by this policy.
